senses.de: Something valuable that a person or company owns which can be used to pay its debts.
senses.ex: Your house is probably your most valuable asset.

Tips.title: Tangible Value
Tips.description: Assets are often physical items but can also include virtual goods or debts.
Tips.example: The factory machines are tangible assets.

Tips.title: Not Always Positive
Tips.description: While assets add value, managing them poorly can become a liability.
Tips.example: He invested poorly, turning his assets into burdens.

senses.de: A quality, skill, or person which is useful or helps you to succeed.
senses.ex: Her ability to speak French is a great asset in her job.

Tips.title: Personal Traits
Tips.description: An 'asset' can describe personal qualities that give someone an advantage.
Tips.example: His patience is an asset in negotiations.

Tips.title: Interchangeable Use
Tips.description: The word 'asset' can be used instead of 'advantage' in many contexts.
Tips.example: Experience with kids is an asset for teaching.

senses.de: In accounting, assets are properties owners' equity.
senses.ex: The company's balance sheet shows its assets and liabilities.

Tips.title: Accounting Balance
Tips.description: In accounting, 'asset' specifically relates to what a business owns.
Tips.example: Our company's assets exceed our liabilities.

Tips.title: Types of Assets
Tips.description: Understanding different asset types is key in business and finance.
Tips.example: They discussed liquid assets in the meeting.

senses.de: In computing, an asset is an identifiable piece of data in electronic format.
senses.ex: This video game has many high-quality assets such as characters and environments.

Tips.title: Digital Components
Tips.description: In computing, assets are items like images, sounds, or code.
Tips.example: We added new assets to the game's files.

Tips.title: Asset vs Data
Tips.description: While both are digital, an asset is a useful and reusable item.
Tips.example: All icons in the app are designed as scalable assets.

senses.de: In legal terms, assets are the properties subject to distribution in a deceased person's will.
senses.ex: All of the deceased's assets will be distributed among his heirs.

Tips.title: Inheritance Context
Tips.description: Legally, 'assets' often refers to items that can be inherited.
Tips.example: Her paintings became valuable assets after she passed away.

Tips.title: Asset Distribution
Tips.description: Assets are distributed according to a person's will or laws.
Tips.example: The lawyer explained the asset distribution to the family.

Advantage.wordDefinition:
An advantage is something that gives you a better chance of succeeding, while an asset is something valuable that you own that can help you succeed.

For example, if you are taking a test and you have good study habits, that is an advantage because it increases your chances of doing well on the test.

Essentially, an advantage is an attribute or skill that benefits you, while an asset is a possession that benefits you.

Belongings.wordDefinition:
Belongings refer to all the personal items that one owns, such as clothing, furniture, and electronics. It is a broader term that can encompass both valuable and non-valuable possessions.

In simpler terms, an asset is something that can be sold or used to generate income, whereas belongings are personal items that hold sentimental or practical value.

Benefit.wordDefinition:
A benefit is something that you gain or receive from a particular thing or activity.

Benefits can be tangible or intangible and can vary depending on the situation.

Some examples of benefits include improved health, increased productivity, or financial gain.

An asset is a valuable possession that can be used to create benefits while the benefit is the advantage or gain from that possession.

Hold.wordDefinition:
Hold is a term used to describe the act of possessing or keeping something.

An asset is what you own, while hold is what you're doing with it. You can hold an asset, such as property or stocks, to increase its value or sell it in the future.

Ultimately, an asset can be held for various reasons, like investment or personal use, but holding is just one of the ways to manage an asset.

Investment.wordDefinition:
An investment is something you put money into with the hope of getting more back in the future, such as a stock or a savings account.

The purpose of an investment is to grow or increase the value of the money you put in.

An asset is something you own, and an investment is something you buy with the hopes of making a profit or getting a return on your money.

Possession.wordDefinition:
Possession refers to the actual ownership or control of something. This can be anything from a physical item like a car to intangible items like digital files or passwords.

In simpler terms, an asset is something you own that has value and can earn money or increase in value, while possession refers to anything you physically have in your possession or control.

A house can be an asset that you own, while a car in your possession is something you physically have control over.

Property.wordDefinition:
Property refers to something that is owned, including assets.

Property can refer to physical items like a car, a house, or a piece of land.

It can also refer to intellectual property like a patent, trademark, or copyright.

In simpler terms, an asset is something that can be sold or converted into cash, while property refers to anything that is owned.

Resource.wordDefinition:
A resource is something that can be used to achieve a particular purpose. It could be a natural resource like water, oil, minerals, or a human resource like labor or expertise.

Resources can be tangible or intangible.

In simpler terms, an asset is a valuable possession or property, while a resource is something that can be used to achieve a desired outcome.

For example, a building is an asset owned by a company, while the knowledge and skills of its employees are resources that can be utilized to achieve business objectives.

Value.wordDefinition:
An asset is something that a person or company owns that can be used to generate income or provide some other value. For example, a car, a house, or a piece of equipment can be considered assets.

Value refers to the worth or usefulness of something.

An asset is something that can be owned, while value is something that can be created or assigned to something else. Both terms are used in finance, business, and economics, but they have slightly different meanings and applications.

quotes.Text: I just assumed the world was full of solo percussionists. I couldn't find sticks or music or anything where I was, but that was expected because there was nothing there anyway. And I think that was possibly the greatest asset for me, just not knowing.
quotes.Title: Scottish Musician
quotes.Name: Evelyn Glennie

quotes.Text: If you have ideas, you have the main asset you need, and there isn't any limit to what you can do with your business and your life. Ideas are any man's greatest asset.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Harvey S. Firestone

quotes.Text: I believe with great fortunes come great responsibility, so with our family's assets and many wealthy friends, we could help raise a lot of money to help others.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Eric Trump

quotes.Text: If you believe, as I do, that your employees truly are your most valuable asset, you will do whatever you can to help them do their jobs as well as possible.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Harvey Mackay

quotes.Text: With age comes the understanding and appreciation of your most important asset, your health.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.Text: There's nothing more important than our good health - that's our principal capital asset.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Arlen Specter

quotes.Text: Honesty and integrity are by far the most important assets of an entrepreneur.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.Text: My instinct is probably one of the strongest assets I've got, workwise.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Gina McKee

quotes.Text: I've always said that our fans are our most important asset.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Jeanie Buss

quotes.Text: Data is the most valuable asset in the world.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Brittany Kaiser
